citation.article-title: Rothia aeria sp. nov., Rhodococcus baikonurensis sp. nov. and Arthrobacter russicus sp. nov., isolated from air in the Russian space laboratory Mir.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rhodococcus baikonurensis sp. nov.
Rhodococcus baikonurensis (bai.kon.ur.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. baikonurensis of Baikonur, the town in Kazakhstan where the Mir space station was launched).
Grows well under aerobic conditions at 30 °C on BHI agar plates.
A mixture of Gram-positive rods and cocci show elementary branching.
Colonies are smooth, opaque and slightly pink.
Biochemical characteristics are summarized in Tables 2 and 3.
Diamino acid in the peptidoglycan is meso-diaminopimelic acid.
Major cellular fatty acids are 16 : 0, cis-18 : 1 and tuberculostearic acid (10-methyl-18 : 0).
Phospholipid composition is phosphatidylethanolamine, cardiolipin, phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylinositol mannosides.
The G+C content of the type strain is 55·5 mol%.
The type strain, A1-22T (=GTC 1041T=JCM 11411T=DSM 44587T), was isolated from an air sample from the Russian space station Mir.
